page.title: 16CLOTHES AND CLOTHING
page.content: Many children in Youlgrave wear jeans or trousers with zips down the sides of their legs and baggy tee-shirts with pop groups on them. The girls wear ankle boots or jelly shoes and the boys wear trainers. In school the children wear uniform. Out of school the clothes are made of bright colours like red, orange and yellow. The coats that children wear are donkey jackets, anoraks or parkas. Men wear jeans or cords and when they go out they wear cords and a jacket, with a white shirt and tie. The shoes that men wear are like boots and when they are on a farm they wear wellies. Ladies and girls wear jewellery like rings, ankle chains, necklaces and bracelets. Ladies wear trousers (but not jeans) or a skirt with a blouse and a jumper. Trina Weller (11)
